title: How Smart Contracts Work
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Smart Contracts Work usable.

hook.text: A smart contract is a program that runs on a blockchain. Once deployed, nobody can change or stop it.

buildup.text: You write rules in code: 'If condition X is met, automatically do Y.' No lawyers, no middlemen.

discovery.text: Smart contracts handle billions in loans, trades, and insurance â€” all executing automatically, 24/7.

twist.text: The downside: bugs in smart contracts can't be patched. Hackers exploit code flaws to drain funds instantly.

climax.text: Smart contracts replace trust in people with trust in code. The code must be perfect â€” there are no do-overs.

punchline.text: Code that enforces deals automatically. No lawyer required.

quiz.question: What makes smart contracts different from traditional contracts?
options: They execute automatically and can't be changed once deployed
